intro: Paepalanthus fasciculifer var. capillifolius, commonly known as the silky haircress, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in some gardens for its visual appeal.
